cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar prepares to transition into the pupa stage as the next life stage.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after caterpillar has grown and stopped eating

remarks: Relation created to encode the developmental progression from caterpillar to pupa.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The adult butterfly life stage emerges from the chrysalis at the end of metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The newly emerged butterfly has just emerged from the chrysalis.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis
remarks: Relation relies on discourse continuity rather than a repeated explicit phrase.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism in one life stage develops into and is replaced by the next defined life stage in its life cycle.
args.justification: This relation encodes a developmental progression from the caterpillar (larval stage) to the pupa stage as the next life stage. The predicate should reflect ordered life-stage transition rather than generic temporality.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage physically emerges from a containing or enclosing biological structure.
args.justification: Both relations describe an adult butterfly (including the newly emerged variant) physically emerging from the chrysalis. They share the same directionality and semantics: an organismal stage coming out of an enclosing structure.

All three relations capture transitions in an organism's development: one between successive life stages (caterpillar to pupa) and two from an enclosing pupal structure to the adult life stage. Grouping them under a developmental-stage transition class is appropriate, even though one pair also involves an enclosing structure.

Each relation fundamentally encodes ordered changes over time in the butterfly's life cycle—progression to the next life stage or emergence after metamorphosis—so they best fit a temporal/sequence-oriented group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism in one life stage develops into and is replaced by the next defined life stage in its life cycle.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation encodes a developmental progression from the caterpillar (larval stage) to the pupa stage as the next life stage. The predicate should reflect ordered life-stage transition rather than generic temporality.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe an adult butterfly (including the newly emerged variant) physically emerging from the chrysalis. They share the same directionality and semantics: an organismal stage coming out of an enclosing structure.

All three relations capture transitions in an organism's development: one between successive life stages (caterpillar to pupa) and two from an enclosing pupal structure to the adult life stage. Grouping them under a developmental-stage transition class is appropriate, even though one pair also involves an enclosing structure.
